intro: Zygodia melanocephala, commonly known as the black-headed zygodia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Restionaceae. It is native to South Africa, where it typically grows in coastal sand dunes and rocky outcrops. The plant is characterized by its slender, wiry stems and small, dark green leaves. Its flowers are clustered in dense, cylindrical inflorescences, often with a reddish or purplish hue. Zygodia melanocephala is adapted to saline and arid environments, showcasing its resilience to harsh coastal conditions.
